We started the restoration two days ago. In three days, all these monuments will be completely restored, Zahi Hawass told Reuters in an interview at his Cairo office. in Iraq has been worth the cost and remains largely unapologetic about his handling of the conflict, The Washington Post reported Wednesday. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today, Donald Rumsfeld wrote in his 800-page memoir, scheduled for release on Tuesday. judicial review into the police handling of the investigation. The Times investigation cited several former NoW journalists stating that Andy Coulson had "actively encouraged" phone hacking. "In fact" , the newspaper continued, an examination based on police records, court documents and interviews with investigators and reHenry Porters shows that Britain's revered police agency failed to pursue leads suggesting that one of the country's most powerful newspapers was routinely listening in on its citizens. This was followed by a Channel 4 "Dispatches" programme, in which it was alleged that Andy Coulson had personally listened to hacked messages. Two parliamentary select committees are involved in inquiries concerning the hacking
